commit_message:
Don't integration test Packstack on release notes or docs patches

This will save gate resources instead of needlessly running
integration tests and will also report CI faster for docs and
release notes updates.

Change-Id: If4b4687ccb8a8aa4662d7c95ffc127396940967d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/54/295854/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: ^gate-packstack-integration-.*-tempest-dsvm-centos7$ skip-if: - project: openstack/packstack all-files-match-any: - ^releasenotes/.*$ - ^docs/.*$

subject: Remove oslo.concurrency from replacement recommendation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-17 16:38:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/pylockfile/commit/d6eef1b6417bacbab1d094302a2dd5ac43d03967', 'message': 'Remove oslo.concurrency from replacement recommendation

Oslo libraries (especially those prefixed with oslo) are
really better suited for usage inside openstack, while libraries
from oslo without that prefix are better suited for all around
general usage so to avoid confusion take off the recommendation
to replace pylockfile with oslo.concurrency and just leave the better
matched fasteners as its replacement.

Change-Id: I1ec1cbfb4c7e371ed93627cffa2b32dbe0401069
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-17 16:52:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'lockfile/symlinklockfile.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/pylockfile/commit/99870bfa02f1ba490da6a59b1499f0f1578c9825', 'message': 'Remove oslo.concurrency from replacement recommendation

Oslo libraries (especially those prefixed with oslo) are
really better suited for usage inside openstack, while libraries
from oslo without that prefix are better suited for all around
general usage so to avoid confusion take off the recommendation
to replace pylockfile with oslo.concurrency and just leave the better
matched fasteners as its replacement.

Also fixes a very tiny flake8 warning that was stopping the
pep8/flake8 job from working.

Change-Id: I1ec1cbfb4c7e371ed93627cffa2b32dbe0401069
'}]
commit_message:
Remove oslo.concurrency from replacement recommendation

Oslo libraries (especially those prefixed with oslo) are
really better suited for usage inside openstack, while libraries
from oslo without that prefix are better suited for all around
general usage so to avoid confusion take off the recommendation
to replace pylockfile with oslo.concurrency and just leave the better
matched fasteners as its replacement.

Also fixes a very tiny flake8 warning that was stopping the
pep8/flake8 job from working.

Change-Id: I1ec1cbfb4c7e371ed93627cffa2b32dbe0401069

commit_message:
Implement cinder protectable plugin

Change-Id: I1ef17f087060b5c7fcbeef4f0dbd170cc98e9b61
Closes-Bug: #1547002
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/11/285611/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import collections import mock from oslo_config import cfg from smaug.context import RequestContext from smaug.resource import Resource from smaug.services.protection.plugins.protectables.volume \ import VolumeProtectablePlugin from smaug.tests import base class VolumeProtectablePluginTest(base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(VolumeProtectablePluginTest, self).setUp() service_catalog = [ {'type': 'volumev2', 'endpoints': [{'publicURL': 'http://127.0.0.1:8776/v2/abcd'}], }, ] self._context = RequestContext(user_id='admin', project_id='abcd', auth_token='efgh', service_catalog=service_catalog) def test_create_client_by_endpoint(self): cfg.CONF.set_default('cinder_endpoint', 'volumev2;http://127.0.0.1:8776/v2;publicURL', 'cinder_client') plugin = VolumeProtectablePlugin(self._context) self.assertEqual('volumev2', plugin.client.client.service_type) self.assertEqual('http://127.0.0.1:8776/v2/abcd', plugin.client.client.management_url) def test_create_client_by_catalog(self): plugin = VolumeProtectablePlugin(self._context) self.assertEqual('volumev2', plugin.client.client.service_type) self.assertEqual('http://127.0.0.1:8776/v2/abcd', plugin.client.client.management_url) def test_get_resource_type(self): plugin = VolumeProtectablePlugin(self._context) self.assertEqual("OS::Cinder::Volume", plugin.get_resource_type()) def test_get_parent_resource_types(self): plugin = VolumeProtectablePlugin(self._context) self.assertEqual(["OS::Nova::Server", ], plugin.get_parent_resource_types()) def test_list_resources(self): plugin = VolumeProtectablePlugin(self._context) plugin.client.volumes.list = mock.MagicMock() vol_info = collections.namedtuple('vol_info', ['id']) plugin.client.volumes.list.return_value = [vol_info('123'), vol_info('456')] self.assertEqual([Resource('OS::Cinder::Volume', '123'), Resource('OS::Cinder::Volume', '456')], plugin.list_resources()) def test_fetch_child_resources(self): plugin = VolumeProtectablePlugin(self._context) plugin.client.volumes.list = mock.MagicMock() vol_info = collections.namedtuple('vol_info', ['id', 'attachments']) attached = [{'server_id': 'abcdef'}] plugin.client.volumes.list.return_value = [vol_info('123', attached), vol_info('456', [])] self.assertEqual([Resource('OS::Cinder::Volume', '123')], plugin.fetch_child_resources(Resource( "OS::Nova::Server", 'abcdef' )))

commit_message:
Creation of a dedicated repo for API and media storage client

Currently the related freezer code to talk to the API and
query the storage media is hosted in the openstack/freezer repo.
We would like to follow the same convention/organization as
other OpenStack projects and place the code on a dedicated repo,
hoping also to reduce complexity and increase readability.

The new repo name would be: openstack/python-freezerclient

Implements blueprint: freezerclient

Needed-By: I0d2ca6623c81185ab8443ade7d0234e4ded63d7f
Change-Id: I8441d5bf0e3dcbb679eb39ad29bf89cd957f37c4

commit_message:
Add tarball creation to packstack project

We're adding tagged releases to packstack so we want to trigger
the upload of the tarball to tarballs.oopenstack.org every time
we tag a release.

Change-Id: I214ebb59af7b1edb860e8a2a4dbaf0bc23c0e3c8

commit_message:
l3_db: it updates port attribute without L2 plugin

L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin._add_interface_by_port update Port.owner
db entry directly without notifying l2 plugin.
Thus L2 plugin/ML2 mechanism driver will be confused when
interface is attached to router by port because port owner is different.
Use L2 plugin update_port method to update port:owner.

Change-Id: If0178887282456842b6078a851a9233cb58a391a
Closes-Bug: #1475093
(cherry picked from commit 0947458018725b241603139f4ec6f92e84b2f29b)

commit_message:
[install] Do not use obsoleted keys in ceilometer config

os_endpoint_type is replaced by service_credentials/interface
os_region_name is replaced by service_credentials/region_name

Change-Id: I3cdc604bde26f89219a3fe9432fb3bd2e79efcaf

commit_message:
Add NFS devstack plugin

Plugin to configure NFS for devstack.

Change-Id: I6cd01169a4d2eeaff3952c4f90254a6fca6615ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/89/289589/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - job-template: name: '{pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-nfs{job-suffix}' node: '{node}' wrappers: - build-timeout: timeout: 180 - timestamps builders: - link-logs - net-info - devstack-checkout - shell: | #!/bin/bash -xe export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_FULL=1 export PROJECTS="{plugin-repo} $PROJECTS" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="enable_plugin devstack-plugin-{plugin} git://git.openstack.org/{plugin-repo}" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+="ENABLE_NFS_CINDER=True" export BRANCH_OVERRIDE={branch-override} if [ "$BRANCH_OVERRIDE" != "default" ] ; then export OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH=$BRANCH_OVERRIDE fi cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh publishers: - devstack-logs - console-log

commit_message:
add Synergy project

The Synergy project extends OpenStack capabilities by providing new
functionalities, such as a new scheduler.

The Synergy project is built around a core service and pluggable extensions
called managers.

In this commit we add:

- synergy-scheduler-manager: the main Synergy manager. It provides new
  scheduling mechanisms for OpenStack. It uses a fairshare algorithm that aims
  to maximize the overall resource usage.

- synergy-service: the core service needed by the aforementioned manager to
  interoperate with OpenStack.

Change-Id: I5c2be2c7c3330b4fcd24a3a55990985f3f28e048
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/57/283157/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Imported Translations from Zanata

For more information about this automatic import see:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Translations/Infrastructure

Change-Id: Id6d76b9684680624f901fbda8d84b23a89dccef7

added_lines:
# Frank Kloeker <eumel@arcor.de>, 2016. #zanata"Project-Id-Version: heat 6.0.0.0rc2.dev8
""POT-Creation-Date: 2016-03-22 09:39+0000
""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-03-22 08:04+0000
" "Last-Translator: Frank Kloeker <eumel@arcor.de>
"msgid "" "A dict of all network addresses with corresponding port_id. Each network " "will have two keys in dict, they are network name and network id. The port " "ID may be obtained through the following expression: "{get_attr: [<server>, " "addresses, <network name_or_id>, 0, port]}"." msgstr "" "Ein Verzeichnis aller Netzadressen mit entsprechender Port-ID. Jedes Netz " "hat zwei Schlssel im Verzeichnis: Netzname und Netz-ID. Die Port-ID kann " "ber den folgenden Ausdruck abgerufen werden: "{get_attr: [<Server>, " "addresses, <Netzname_oder_Netz-ID>, 0, port]}"." msgid "" "A dict of assigned network addresses of the form: {"public": [ip1, " "ip2...], "private": [ip3, ip4], "public_uuid": [ip1, ip2...], " ""private_uuid": [ip3, ip4]}. Each network will have two keys in dict, they " "are network name and network id." msgstr "" "Ein Verzeichnis der zugeordneten Netzadressen im Format: {"public": [IP1, " "IP2...], "private": [IP3, IP4], "public_uuid": [IP1, IP2...], " ""private_uuid": [IP3, IP4]}. Jedes Netz hat zwei Schlssel im Verzeichnis: " "Netzname und Netz-ID." "A per-tenant quota on the prefix space that can be allocated from the subnet " "pool for tenant subnets." msgstr "" "Ein Kontingent pro Mandant fr den Prfixbereich, der aus dem Subnetzpool " "fr Mandantensubnetze zugeordnet werden kann. " msgid """Allow reauthentication on token expiry, such that long-running tasks may " "complete. Note this defeats the expiry of any provided user tokens." msgstr "" "Re-Authentifizierung bei Tokenablauf zulassen, sodass Aufgaben mit langer " "Ausfhrungszeit abgeschlossen werden knnen. Beachten Sie, dass dies den " "Ablauf aller angegebenen Benutzertoken verhindert." msgid ""msgid "" "Allows to synchronize multiple parallel workflow branches and aggregate " "their data. Valid inputs: all - the task will run only if all upstream tasks " "are completed. Any numeric value - then the task will run once at least this " "number of upstream tasks are completed and corresponding conditions have " "triggered." msgstr "" "Ermglicht die Synchronisierung mehrerer paralleler " "Arbeitsablaufverzweigungen und die Aggregation der zugehrigen Daten. " "Gltige Eingaben: all - Die Aufgabe wird nur ausgefhrt, wenn alle " "Upstreamaufgaben abgeschlossen sind. Ein beliebiger numerischer Wert - Die " "Aufgabe wird nur ein einziges Mal ausgefhrt, wenn mindestens die genannte " "Anzahl an Upstreamaufgaben abgeschlossen ist und die entsprechenden " "Bedingungen ausgelst wurden." msgid "" "Boolean extra spec that used for filtering of backends by their capability " "to create share snapshots." msgstr "" "Boolescher Wert fr extra Spezifikation zum Filtern von Backends " "hinsichtlich der Fhigkeit, Freigaben fr Schattenkopien erstellen zu knnen." msgid "" "Content of part to attach, either inline or by referencing the ID of another " "software config resource." msgstr "" "Inhalt des anzuhngenden Teils, entweder integriert oder durch Verweis auf " "die ID einer anderen Softwarekonfigurationsressource." "for signalling handle completion or failure when signal_transport is set to " "TOKEN_SIGNAL. You can signal success by adding --data-binary '{"status": " ""SUCCESS"}' , or signal failure by adding --data-binary '{"status": " ""FAILURE"}'. This attribute is set to None for all other signal transports." msgstr "" "Optionsattribut. Gibt das Prfix fr den CLI-Befehl 'curl' an, der dazu " "verwendet werden kann, eine Kennungsfertigstellung oder einen Fehler zu " "signalisieren, wenn 'signal_transport' auf TOKEN_SIGNAL gesetzt ist. Sie " "knnen das Signal fr einen Erfolg geben, indem Sie --data-binary '{"status" "": "SUCCESS"}' hinzufgen oder das Signal fr einen Fehler, indem Sie --" "data-binary '{"status": "FAILURE"}' hinzufgen. Dieses Attribut ist fr " "alle anderen Signaltransporte auf 'None' gesetzt." msgid "" "Convenience attribute, provides curl CLI command prefix, which can be used ""Defines the method in which the request body for signaling a workflow would " "be parsed. In case this property is set to True, the body would be parsed as " "a simple json where each key is a workflow input, in other cases body would " "be parsed expecting a specific json format with two keys: "input" and " ""params"." msgstr "" "Definiert die Methode, mit der der Anforderungshauptteil zum Signalisieren " "eines Arbeitsablaufs syntaktisch analysiert werden kann. Wenn diese " "Eigenschaft auf 'True' gesetzt ist, wird der Hauptteil wie einfaches JSON, " "wo jeder Schlssel eine Arbeitsablaufeingabe ist, syntaktisch analysiert. In " "anderen Fllen wird fr die syntaktische Analyse des Hauptteils ein " "bestimtes JSON-Format mit zwei Schlsseln erwartet: "input" und "params"." msgid ""msgid "" "Describe time constraints for the alarm. Only evaluate the alarm if the time " "at evaluation is within this time constraint. Start point(s) of the " "constraint are specified with a cron expression, whereas its duration is " "given in seconds." msgstr "" "Geben Sie Zeiteinschrnkungen fr den Alarm an. Werten Sie den Alarm nur " "aus, wenn sich der Zeitpunkt der Auswertung innerhalb dieser " "Zeiteinschrnkung befindet. Anfangspunkte der Einschrnkung werden mit einem " "Cron-Ausdruck angegeben, whrend die zugehrige Dauer in Sekunden angegeben " "wird. " msgid "Description of keystone service." msgstr "Beschreibung des Keystone-Diensts." msgid "Either project or domain must be specified for role %s" msgstr "" "Fr die Rolle %s muss entweder ein Projekt oder eine Domne angegeben werden." #, python-formatmsgid "" "Endpoint/url which can be used for signalling handle when signal_transport " "is set to TOKEN_SIGNAL. None for all other signal transports." msgstr "" "Endpunkt/URL zur Verwendung fr das Kennungssignal, wenn 'signal_transport' " "auf TOKEN_SIGNAL gesetzt ist. 'None' fr alle anderen Signaltransporte." msgid "" "How the client will signal the wait condition. CFN_SIGNAL will allow an HTTP " "POST to a CFN keypair signed URL. TEMP_URL_SIGNAL will create a Swift " "TempURL to be signalled via HTTP PUT. HEAT_SIGNAL will allow calls to the " "Heat API resource-signal using the provided keystone credentials. " "ZAQAR_SIGNAL will create a dedicated zaqar queue to be signalled using the " "provided keystone credentials. TOKEN_SIGNAL will allow and HTTP POST to a " "Heat API endpoint with the provided keystone token. NO_SIGNAL will result in " "the resource going to a signalled state without waiting for any signal." msgstr "" "Gibt an, wie der Client die Wartebedingung signalisiert. CFN_SIGNAL " "ermglicht einen HTTP POST an eine mit einem CFN-Schlsselpaar signierte " "URL. TEMP_URL_SIGNAL erstellt eine Swift-TempURL, die ber HTTP PUT " "signalisiert werden soll. HEAT_SIGNAL ermglicht Aufrufe an die Heat-API " "'resource-signal' mit den angegebenen Keystone-Berechtigungsnachweisen. " "ZAQAR_SIGNAL erstellt eine dedizierte Zaqar-Warteschlange, die mit den " "angegebenen Keystone-Berechtigungsnachweisen signalisiert werden soll. " "TOKEN_SIGNAL ermglicht einen HTTP POST an einen Heat-API-Endpunkt mit dem " "angegebenen Keystone-Token. NO_SIGNAL bedeutet, dass die Ressource einen " "Signalstatus annimmt, ohne auf ein Signal zu warten." msgid "" "How the server should receive the metadata required for software " "configuration. POLL_SERVER_CFN will allow calls to the cfn API action " "DescribeStackResource authenticated with the provided keypair. " "POLL_SERVER_HEAT will allow calls to the Heat API resource-show using the " "provided keystone credentials. POLL_TEMP_URL will create and populate a " "Swift TempURL with metadata for polling. ZAQAR_MESSAGE will create a " "dedicated zaqar queue and post the metadata for polling." msgstr "" "Gibt an, wie der Server die fr die Softwarekonfiguration erforderlichen " "Metadaten empfangen soll. POLL_SERVER_CFN ermglicht Aufrufe an die cfn-API-" "Aktion 'DescribeStackResource', die mit dem angegebenen Schlsselpaar " "authentifiziert wurde. POLL_SERVER_HEAT ermglicht Aufrufe an die Heat-API " "'resource-show' unter Verwendung der angegebenen Keystone-" "Berechtigungsnachweise. POLL_TEMP_URL erstellt eine Swift-TempURL und fllt " "sie mit Metadaten fr das Polling. ZAQAR_MESSAGE erstellt eine dedizierte " "Zaqar-Warteschlange und postet die Metadaten fr das Polling." "How the server should signal to heat with the deployment output values. " "CFN_SIGNAL will allow an HTTP POST to a CFN keypair signed URL. " "TEMP_URL_SIGNAL will create a Swift TempURL to be signaled via HTTP PUT. " "HEAT_SIGNAL will allow calls to the Heat API resource-signal using the " "provided keystone credentials. ZAQAR_SIGNAL will create a dedicated zaqar " "queue to be signaled using the provided keystone credentials. NO_SIGNAL will " "result in the resource going to the COMPLETE state without waiting for any " "signal." msgstr "" "Gibt an, wie der Server Heat die Implementierungsausgabewerte signalisieren " "soll. CFN_SIGNAL ermglicht einen HTTP POST an eine mit einem CFN-" "Schlsselpaar signierte URL. TEMP_URL_SIGNAL erstellt eine Swift-TempURL, " "die ber HTTP PUT signalisiert werden soll. HEAT_SIGNAL ermglicht Aufrufe " "an die Heat-API 'resource-signal' mit den angegebenen Keystone-" "Berechtigungsnachweisen. ZAQAR_SIGNAL erstellt eine dedizierte Zaqar-" "Warteschlange, die mit den angegebenen Keystone-Berechtigungsnachweisen " "signalisiert werden soll. NO_SIGNAL bedeutet, dass die Ressource den Status " "COMPLETE annimmt, ohne auf ein Signal zu warten." msgid ""msgid "Human-readable name for the container." msgstr "Lesbarer Name fr den Container." "If the region is hierarchically a child of another region, set this " "parameter to the ID of the parent region." msgstr "" "Wenn die Region in der Hierarchie eine untergeordnete Region einer anderen " "Region ist, setzen Sie diesen Parameter auf die ID der bergeordneten Region." msgid """JSON serialized map that includes the endpoint, token and/or other " "attributes the client must use for signalling this handle. "Number of times to check whether an interface has been attached or detached." msgstr "" "Anzahl an Versuchen, bei denen geprft werden soll, ob eine Schnittstelle " "angehngt oder abgehngt wurde." msgid ""msgid "Number value for delay during resolve constraint." msgstr "Zahlenwert fr die Verzgerung beim Auflsen der Beschrnkung." msgid "" "On update, enables heat to collect existing resource properties from reality " "and converge to updated template." msgstr "" "Ermglicht Heat, bei Aktualisierung tatschlich vorhandene " "Ressourceneigenschaften zu erfassen und mit den aktualisierten Vorlagen " "zusammenzufhren." msgid "PATCH update to non-COMPLETE stack" msgstr "PATCH-Aktualisierung fr Stack mit Status 'non-COMPLETE' " "Property %(key)s updated value %(new)s should be superset of existing value " "%(old)s." msgstr "" "Der aktualisierte Wert %(new)s der Eigenschaft %(key)s muss eine Obermenge " "des vorhandenen Werts %(old)s sein." #, python-format msgid ""msgid "Reference to the secret." msgstr "Referenz auf den geheimen Schlssel." msgid "References to secrets that will be stored in container." msgstr "Referenzen auf geheime Schlssel, die im Container gespeichert werden." msgid "Signal resource during %s" msgstr "Ressource whrend %s signalisieren." #, python-formatmsgid "Suspend of instance %s failed" msgstr "Aussetzen der Instanz %s fehlgeschlagen." #, python-formatmsgid "" "Template default for how the server should receive the metadata required for " "software configuration. " "ZAQAR_MESSAGE erstellt eine dedizierte Zaqar-Warteschlange und postet die " "Metadaten fr das Polling." msgid "" "Template default for how the server should signal to heat with the " "deployment output values. CFN_SIGNAL will allow an HTTP POST to a CFN " "keypair signed URL (requires enabled heat-api-cfn). Beachten Sie, dass HARestarter " "nicht tatschlich Server erneut startet: Er lscht sie und erstellt sie " "anschlieend erneut. Darber hinaus macht er dasselbe mit allen abhngigen " "Ressourcen. Dies kann daher unerwartetes und nicht gewnschtes Verhalten " "auslsen. Vermeiden Sie es, HARestarter zu verwenden." " msgid """When this feature is enabled, scheduler hints identifying the heat stack " "context of a server or volume resource are passed to the configured " "schedulers in nova and cinder, for creates done using heat resource types " "OS::Cinder::Volume, OS::Nova::Server, and AWS::EC2::Instance. " "heat_root_stack_id will be set to the id of the root stack of the resource, " "heat_stack_id will be set to the id of the resource's parent stack, " "heat_stack_name will be set to the name of the resource's parent stack, " "heat_path_in_stack will be set to a list of tuples, (stackresourcename, " "stackname) with list[0] being (None, rootstackname), heat_resource_name will " "be set to the resource's name, and heat_resource_uuid will be set to the " "resource's orchestration id." msgstr "" "Wenn dieses Feature aktiviert ist, werden Schedulerhinweise, die den Heat-" "Stack-Kontext eines Servers oder einer Datentrgerressource angeben, an die " "konfigurierten Scheduler in Nova und Cinder bergeben, und zwar fr erfolgte " "Erstellungen mithilfe von Heat-Ressourcentypen OS::Cinder::Volume, OS::Nova::" "Server und AWS::EC2::Instance. 'heat_root_stack_id' wird auf die ID des Root-" "Stacks der Ressource gesetzt, 'heat_stack_id' auf die ID des bergeordneten " "Stacks der Ressource gesetzt, 'heat_stack_name' auf den Namen des " "bergeordneten Stacks der Ressource gesetzt, 'heat_path_in_stack' auf eine " "Tupel-Liste gesetzt, (stackresourcename, stackname) mit list[0] und (None, " "rootstackname), 'heat_resource_name' auf den Namen der Ressource und " "'heat_resource_uuid' auf die Orchestrierungs-ID der Ressource gesetzt." msgid ""

commit_message:
Add support for global dimensions

If global dimensions are specified at top level, then do not
require per log entry level dimensions. If both global and
per log level dimensions are provided, then the per log level
dimensions will override the global one.

Change-Id: I4576383e4182916953d18dce55a65737116e1f74
implements: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273058
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-log-api refs/changes/41/286341/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: common_dimensions = self._get_global_dimensions(request_body) if common_dimensions: dimensions_expected = False else: dimensions_expected = True # if common dimensions are specified, then it is optional to # specify it per log element. If both are specified, it overrides # the common dimensions dimensions = self._get_dimensions(log_element, dimensions_expected) if not dimensions: # use the common dimensions instead dimensions = common_dimensions def _get_dimensions(self, log_element, dimensions_expected=True): dimensions = None if 'dimensions' in log_element: dimensions = log_element['dimensions'] elif dimensions_expected: return dimensions def _get_global_dimensions(self, request_body): """Get the top level dimensions in the HTTP request body.""" if 'dimensions' not in request_body: return None return request_body['dimensions']
deleted_lines: dimensions = self._get_dimensions(log_element) def _get_dimensions(self, log_element): if 'dimensions' not in log_element: return log_element['dimensions']

commit_message:
Fixed DesignateContext.is_admin is false on admin tenant

DesignateContext.is_admin is false while its role holds ['admin'] on admin
tenant context. Thanks to our default policy.json that the admin rule is
defined as "role:admin or is_admin:True" which avoids most bad effects of this
bug.

Change-Id: I99cc09454c83eef49bf0b8c1e429f46954d7b3fb
Closes-Bug: 1456115
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/32/184432/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self.is_admin is None: self.is_admin = policy.check_is_admin(self)

commit_message:
Allow creating sub-domains with different tenant_id

Allow creating sub-domains with different tenant_id with parent domain, when
X-Auth-Sudo-Tenant-ID header has been set.

Change-Id: Ibc820d98183dff34e489942fc0d5aa779b1c6ce6
Closes-Bug: 1459554
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/48/186648/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE: Parent domain and sub-domain belongs to same tenant or # X-Auth-Sudo-Tenant-ID header has been used if (parent_domain.tenant_id == domain.tenant_id or context.original_tenant):

commit_message:
Flavor object which support both DB with active migration

This patch modifies Flavor object's methods like create(), get_all(),
get_by_flavor_id(), get_by_name() ,get_by_id() , save(), destroy() etc.
Before creating flavor, it checks both nova DB and API DB for duplicates.
get_* methods get information from both DB. New option for migrate all
flavors from nova to api is added in nova-manage.
example: nova-manage flavor migrate_all

Implements: blueprint flavor-cell-api

Change-Id: Id0e600f0345f3a8b70f5229ce3275b0d98a330b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/41/213041/22 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-22 21:18:31.000000000', 'files': ['octane/util/fuel_client.py', 'octane/tests/test_archivators_restore.py', 'octane/tests/test_util_fuelclient.py', 'octane/handlers/backup_restore/postgres.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane/commit/0e22281bddc52a91aa7f88945bd6d7a0c4150ac5', 'message': "Set keystone auth context for fuel client

This context is required for the proper initialization of the
fuel client. Set password to the value parsed from CLI argument
--admin-password in for 'fuel-restore' command.

Set the context in the upgrade handler class since different
archivers can potentially have different auth contexts (i.e.
before and after restore of Keystone DB the passwords for
'admin' user may be different).

Change-Id: If3a41a332f2422053c8cacfb7b0834616649bc32
Closes-bug: 1560179
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Abramov <sabramov@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Set keystone auth context for fuel client

This context is required for the proper initialization of the
fuel client. Set password to the value parsed from CLI argument
--admin-password in for 'fuel-restore' command.

Set the context in the upgrade handler class since different
archivers can potentially have different auth contexts (i.e.
before and after restore of Keystone DB the passwords for
'admin' user may be different).

Change-Id: If3a41a332f2422053c8cacfb7b0834616649bc32
Closes-bug: 1560179
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Abramov <sabramov@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9f0c9c3afcf1db65b0bbeb5c2b6526e10671a08c)

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from fuelclient import client from fuelclient import fuelclient_settings from octane.util import fuel_client def test_simple_overwrite(mocker): class TestContext(object): user = "test user" password = "test password" conf = fuelclient_settings.get_settings() client_val = "Not empty val" assert conf.KEYSTONE_USER == client.APIClient.user assert conf.KEYSTONE_PASS == client.APIClient.password assert client.APIClient._session is None assert client.APIClient._keystone_client is None client.APIClient._session = client.APIClient._keystone_client = client_val with fuel_client.set_auth_context(TestContext()): assert TestContext.user == client.APIClient.user assert TestContext.password == client.APIClient.password assert client.APIClient._session is None assert client.APIClient._keystone_client is None client.APIClient._session = client_val client.APIClient._keystone_client = client_val assert conf.KEYSTONE_USER == client.APIClient.user assert conf.KEYSTONE_PASS == client.APIClient.password assert client.APIClient._session is None assert client.APIClient._keystone_client is None

commit_message:
rack,sahara, tacker: Use db setup for python jobs

Use the python db jobs. These run the same tests as the normal jobs,
just setup databases. This is in preparation for a future cleanup of
the default python jobs so that they those not run databases by default.
These repos need databases setup for unit tests.

Change-Id: I127f0a1d167e00839f01566ec09a37bbabaed6b3

The coordination url connection string to redis
is incorrectly formatted with password.

More details: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1320036

commit_message:
Add retries to avoid dberror for user_creds_delete

Add retries for user_creds_delete.

Also adds cascade_backrefs=False to the relationship
between user_creds and stack.

Change-Id: I0e242c008d3368d30708b52f83f998b77aff5f35
Closes-Bug: #1545577

added_lines: stack = relationship(Stack, backref=backref('user_creds', cascade_backrefs=False))

Added note about nested environment

Added information when using nested environment for Kolla deployment.

Added check command to verify hardware acceleration

Change-Id: I6cb43ebbf11b5cf34f866fdccb550e9641a47f6c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/89/295389/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. NOTE:: In case of deploying using the _nested_ environment (*eg*. Using Virtualbox VM's, vSphere VM's), please make sure that you are using **QUEMU** hypervisor in compute node. For this, change the **virt_type** option in the `[libvirt]` section of **nova-compute.conf** file inside the **/etc/kolla/config/** directory. :: [libvirt] virt_type=qemu

deleted_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-03-09 18:34+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-03-15 12:44+0000\n"msgid "" "Images come from the glance service to the nova service on a node. This " "transfer should be protected by running over TLS. Once the image is on the " "node, it is verified with a basic checksum and then it's disk is expanded " "based on the size of the instance being launched. If, at a later time, the " "same image is launched with the same instance size on this node, it will be " "launched from the same expanded image. Since this expanded image is not re-" "verified before launching, it could be tampered with and the user would not " "have any way of knowing, beyond a manual inspection of the files in the " "resulting image." msgstr "" "GlanceNovaTLS" "" "checksum" "" "" "" "" msgid "" "OpenStack :term:`Compute` service (nova) provides services to support the " "management of virtual machine instances at scale, instances that host multi-" "tiered applications, dev/test environments, \"Big Data\" crunching Hadoop " "clusters, and/or high performance computing." msgstr "" "OpenStack :term:`Compute`  (Nova) /" " Hadoop " "" "" "The OpenStack :term:`Block Storage` service (cinder) provides persistent " "block storage for compute instances. The Block Storage service is " "responsible for managing the life-cycle of block devices, from the creation " "and attachment of volumes to instances, to their release." msgstr "" "OpenStack :term:`Block Storage` Service (cinder) Compute " "Block Storage Service " "" "" msgid "" "The OpenStack :term:`Identity` service (keystone) is a **shared service** " "that provides authentication and authorization services throughout the " "entire cloud infrastructure. The Identity service has pluggable support for " "multiple forms of authentication." msgstr "" "OpenStack :term:`Identity` (keystone) " "****Identity " "" msgid """The OpenStack :term:`Networking` service (neutron, previously called " "quantum) provides various networking services to cloud users (tenants) such " "as IP address management, DNS, DHCP, load balancing, and security groups " "(network access rules, like firewall policies). The Object Storage " "service provides both a native API and an Amazon Web Services S3 compatible " "API. The service provides a high degree of resiliency through data " "replication and can handle petabytes of data." msgstr "" "OpenStack :term:`Object Storage` Service (swift) " "/Object Storage Service  " "API  Amazon Web Services S3  API " "" "" msgid "" "The OpenStack :term:`dashboard` (horizon) provides a web-based interface for " "both cloud administrators and cloud tenants. commit_message:
Set default locale to image in debootstrap element

Set is to C.UTF-8 as default, to reuse what is
available on this base image.

Change-Id: I3d2517582b836b2c6ec05538e6f9c58cada66965
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/89/290789/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The `DIB_DEFAULT_LOCALE` environment variable may be used to set a default locale for the image. It defaults to en_US.UTF-8.

commit_message:
policy: Support YAML

Add a spec that proposes changing oslo.policy to support YAML as
a file format for the policy files.

Change-Id: Icde04678eb0a8f6c3ff1d3f4300f4c9032198829
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/25/279725/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============================== Support policy files in YAML ============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo?searchtext=policy-yaml JSON is great for a wire format, but awful for a configuration file. oslo.policy can easily also support a safe subset of YAML. Problem description =================== The policy files for the services can be complicated and hard to use. Even knowing what operations are protected by what rules is difficult since the operation name (e.g., ``identity:create_user``) isn't the same as the operation the user performs (e.g., ``PUT /v3/users``). The sample policy files would be a lot more usable if we could simply put a comment in the file saying what the user operation is for the rule, but the only format allowed (JSON) doesn't support comments. Use Cases --------- As a deployer, I should be able to comment the policy file with descriptions for my custom roles and rules. As a developer, I should be able to provide a sample policy file that's self-describing. As in, add comments to the sample policy file. Proposed change =============== Rather than parse the policy file using the JSON parser, oslo.policy will parse it using the YAML parser (provided by PyYAML). Since JSON is a subset of YAML existing JSON files will continue to work. Projects and deployers can switch to simplified YAML and document using comments if they want. `oslo.policy` will be changed to use PyYAML's `safe_load()` to parse the policy file rather than the JSON parser ( `jsonutils.loads()` ). For some reason the name of the method to read the policy file includes the format. This was incorrect to begin with and is made even less accurate since the format is YAML, so rename `load_json()` to `load()` (keeping the old method name around but deprecated, using debtcollector). oslo.policy defines a `policy_file` config option which defaults to ``policy.json``. This should change to default to ``policy.yaml``, but also look for ``policy.json`` if `policy.yaml` doesn't exist. Files to change: * oslo_policy/policy.py * oslo_policy/opts.py * requirements.txt Alternatives ------------ We could preprocess the JSON files to remove lines that look like comments. But then the format isn't really JSON and is not a standard format. We could have separate loaders for JSON vs YAML and use the parser based on the file extension. This is possible but is unnecessary since JSON is a subset of YAML. Impact on Existing APIs ----------------------- The `oslo_policy.policy.Rules` class's `load_json` method will be renamed to `load`. `load_json` will be deprecated. Security impact --------------- In its most general form, YAML allows the document to contain executable code that's then run. We don't want our policy files to be allowed to contain executable code. As such, we'll use safe_load instead of load(). http://pyyaml.org/wiki/PyYAMLDocumentation#LoadingYAML Performance Impact ------------------ I don't know if the YAML parser is a lot slower, but since it supports several representations for the same result I assume it takes more work to parse it. The policy file is read when the server starts and also whenever the file changes (it used to be read on every request, but that's been changed to check the modification time), so I don't think this is going to be noticable. Configuration Impact -------------------- None. Developer Impact ---------------- The different projects all have sample policy.json files. These files should be renamed to policy.yaml, the format changed to simplified YAML, and comments added. This doesn't have to happen immediately since policy.json will continue to work. Testing Impact -------------- The projects are already loading their policy files during gate testing. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: blk-u Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: mitaka-3 Work Items ---------- * Change oslo.policy to use yaml.safe_load() rather than json.loads() * Rename oslo_policy.policy.Rules load_json() to load(), use debtcollector to rename. * Change oslo.policy to look for ``policy.yaml`` first and then look for ``policy.json``. `policy_dirs` will also use this. * References to JSON need to be changed to YAML in general: ** `policy_file` help text. Incubation ========== N/A Adoption -------- N/A Library ------- N/A Anticipated API Stabilization ----------------------------- N/A Documentation Impact ==================== If the documentation mentions that the policy file is in JSON format then that can be changed to say YAML format. Any policy sample files should be changed to the simpler YAML format rather than JSON. Dependencies ============ oslo.policy will depend on PyYAML. This is already in global-requirements. References ========== debtcollector: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/debtcollector/ JSON: http://www.json.org/ oslo.policy: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.policy/ http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.policy/ PyYAML: http://pyyaml.org/ YAML: http://yaml.org/ .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

Fix wrong indent bug in _get_private_router

The exception ServiceInstanceException with
'Subnet gateway is not attached to the router'
has wrong indent.

commit_message:
Switch voting to false for oslo.messaging+dsvm jobs

Best practice is to make sure both check and gate
queues have entries if a job is voting. Since some
of these jobs are still fragile, we should mark the
jobs as non-voting.

Change-Id: I374ea613c7cd50843a89a5ce92fe2bb1707f17ea

commit_message:
Support py34 functional tests for Oslo.Messaging

We need to be able to run functional tests using
python34 for oslo.messaging. Necessary changes
in oslo.messaging are already merged in:
Ibc695762fb12b60a8094be187001dd2bd42f402e

Change-Id: Ifdbd4ab1eae6c5e5364a99906995dff3bb1ff4f0

commit_message:
sqlalchemy-migrate: Use db setup for python jobs

Use the python db jobs. These run the same tests as the normal jobs,
just setup databases. This is in preparation for a future cleanup of
the default python jobs so that they those not run databases by default.
This repo needs databases setup for unit tests.

Change-Id: I06eed49d63cef12169195d234a5ff0e4682def06

commit_message:
trove: Use db setup for python jobs

Use the python db jobs. These run the same tests as the normal jobs,
just setup databases. This is in preparation for a future cleanup of
the default python jobs so that they those not run databases by default.
This repo needs databases setup for unit tests.

Change-Id: I48b1ef7211151ba1e233c6196b5caab96fbf03d4

commit_message:
Not transform to str on potential unicode fields

some fields such as instance.display_name can be unicode,
nova client should not translate it to 'str'. otherwise
it will report UnicodeEncodeError.

Change-Id: I4f6011105b3b11dbbcb23f3a7c1bbcf7f20bcc8c
Closes-Bug: 1518141
(cherry picked from commit 8b8edc72e0b9eedbcadbef2643dca0c69dd35dba)

commit_message:
Fix race condition when toggling SP

Currently, VNX driver provides SP toggle feature which would try
another IP if primary IP became unavailable.
Unfortunately, driver did not protect the toggling SP logic in a
lock section so if many toggles happen in a short time, race
condition may occur and driver would try the unavailable IP again.

This fix provides a safe way to toggle and swap current primary IP
to avoid above mentioned issue.

Change-Id: I4af960a625dafbe868f12d275cf9b34eb254a388
Closes-Bug: 1526600

commit_message:
Graceful ovs-agent restart

This patch is a backport of the patches:
https://review.openstack.org/182920
https://review.openstack.org/215596
https://review.openstack.org/243915

This change adds an ability to drop only old flows on a restart
of the ovs-agent.  An agent_uuid_stamp is set as cookie for flows
and then flows with stale cookies are deleted during cleanup.

Change-Id: I77efc403f448115c2f6466c52424994a5ddadede
Closes-bug: #1383674
Related-bug: #1515075

added_lines: Object Storage uses the following components to deliver high availability, high durability, and high concurrency: - **Proxy servers** - Handle all of the incoming API requests. - **Rings** - Map logical names of data to locations on particular- **Zones** - Isolate data from other zones. A failure in one zone does not impact the rest of the cluster as data replicates- **Accounts and containers** - Each account and container are- **Objects** - The data itself. - **Partitions** - A partition stores objects, account databases, and`https://swift.example.com/v1/account/container/object`. Proxy serversFor more information concerning proxy server configuration, please see<http://docs.openstack.org/liberty/config-reference/content/proxy-server-configuration.html>`_.A ring represents a mapping between the names of entities stored on disksThese rings are externally managed. The server processes themselves do not modify the rings, they are instead given new rings modified by other tools. The ring uses a configurable number of bits from an ``MD5`` hash for a pathpower indicates the partition count. Partitioning the full ``MD5`` hash ringboundaries. If possible, each data replica resides in a separate zone.A partition is a collection of stored data. This includes account databases,
deleted_lines: The components that enable Object Storage to deliver high availability, high durability, and high concurrency are: - **Proxy servers.** Handle all of the incoming API requests. - **Rings.** Map logical names of data to locations on particular- **Zones.** Isolate data from other zones. A failure in one zone doesn't impact the rest of the cluster because data is replicated- **Accounts and containers.** Each account and container are- **Objects.** The data itself. - **Partitions.** A partition stores objects, account databases, andhttps://swift.example.com/v1/account/container/object. Proxy serversFor more information concerning proxy server configuration, please see the<http://docs.openstack.org/liberty/config-reference/content/proxy-server-configuration.html>`__.A ring represents a mapping between the names of entities stored on disk These rings are externally managed, in that the server processes themselves do not modify the rings, they are instead given new rings modified by other tools. The ring uses a configurable number of bits from an MD5 hash for a pathpower indicates the partition count. Partitioning the full MD5 hash ringboundaries. Each data replica resides in a separate zone, if possible.As mentioned earlier, everything in Object Storage is stored, by default, three times. Swift will place each replica "as-uniquely-as-possible" to ensure both high availability and high durability. This means that when choosing a replica location, Object Storage chooses a server in an unused zone before an unused server in a zone that already has a replica of the data. When a disk fails, replica data is automatically distributed to the other zones to ensure there are three copies of the data. A partition is a collection of stored data, including account databases,

commit_message:
Set max supported compute microversion for tempest

In Mitaka, compute max supported microversion is 2.25
 - http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_history.html#maximum-in-mitaka

Devstack needs to cap the same on tempest.

Change-Id: If08027bd23934f4aa1a0d1b33cd27cc534837ba9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/52/296152/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Setting [None, 2.25] as 2.25 is maximum supported microversion in Mitaka. local tempest_compute_max_microversion=${TEMPEST_COMPUTE_MAX_MICROVERSION:-2.25}
deleted_lines: # Setting [None, latest] range of microversion which allow Tempest to run all microversions tests. # NOTE- To avoid microversion tests failure on stable branch, we need to change "tempest_compute_max_microversion" # for stable branch on each release which should be changed from "latest" to max supported version of that release. local tempest_compute_max_microversion=${TEMPEST_COMPUTE_MAX_MICROVERSION:-"latest"}

commit_message:
Report 2.0 as supported version of RPC APIs

When bumping major versions of RPC APIs from 1.x to 2.0 I haven't raised
the version the managers are reporting into the `services` table.
Though this doesn't have any immediate consequences, it effectively
blocks us from dropping 1.x support in Newton, because we need that
support to downgrade the messages to what Mitaka reports.

This commit fixes that problem by making the Mitaka's services to report
2.0 as RPC API version.

Closes-Bug: 1560062

Change-Id: I45e695025f1cb38fd8b062593b29da7463ba22fc
(cherry picked from commit c56ace1b3bafccaa16060de05bef67f87853a95a)

commit_message:
Support dimensions that multibyte characters are contained.

When specifing multibyte characters to dimension key in the configuration file of the check plugin, the graph is displayed on "Graph Metrics"(grafana).
Closes-Bug: #1486307

Change-Id: I0f7fa6165be16a26181c2c4a3d958bef66c50052
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-ui refs/changes/58/291058/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name = dimension_name_value[0].encode('utf8') value = dimension_name_value[1].encode('utf8') dim_dict[name] = urllib.unquote(value)
deleted_lines: name = dimension_name_value[0] value = dimension_name_value[1] dim_dict[name] = urllib.unquote(value).decode('utf8')

commit_message:
Magnum Container Networking Spec

Previously, Magnum did not contain a specification that outlines
how the project intends to provide networking to containers. This
patch provides an initial container networking specification.

Change-Id: I7783dc3c351dbcba63b74f5fdf3223e664f3af13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/86/204686/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================= Magnum Container Networking Model ================================= Launchpad Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/extensible-network-model For Magnum to prosper, the project must support a range of networking tools and techniques, while maintaining a simple, developer-focused user experience. The first step in achieving this goal is to standardize the process of allocating networking to containers, while providing an abstraction for supporting various networking capabilities through pluggable back-end implementations. Instead of creating a networking-specific plugin framework, this document suggests following the common plugin framework blueprint[1] for implementing Magnum's Container Networking Model. Problem Description =================== The container networking ecosystem is undergoing rapid changes. The networking tools and techniques used in today's container deployments are different than twelve months ago and will continue to evolve. For example, Flannel[6], Kubernetes preferred networking implementation, was initially released July 2014 and was not considered preferred until early 2015. Furthermore, the various container orchestration engines have not standardized on a container networking implementation and may never. For example, Flannel is the preferred container networking implementation for Kubernetes but not for Docker Swarm. Each container networking implementation comes with its own API abstractions, data model, tooling, etc.. Natively supporting each container networking implementation can be a burden on the Magnum community and codebase. By supporting only a subset of container networking implementations, the project may not be widely adopted or may provide a suboptimal user experience. Lastly, Magnum has limited support for advanced container networking functionality. Magnum instantiates container networks behind the scenes through Heat templates, exposing little-to-no user configurability. Some users require the ability to customize their container environments, including networking details. However, networking needs to "just work" for users that require no networking customizations. Roles ----- The following are roles that the Magnum Container Networking Model takes into consideration. Roles are an important reference point when creating user stories. This is because each role provides different functions and has different requirements. 1. Cloud Provider (CP): Provides standard OpenStack cloud infrastructure services, including the Magnum service. 2. Container Service Provider (CSP): Uses Magnum to deliver Containers-as-a-Service (CaaS) to users. CSPs are a consumer of CP services and a CaaS provider to users. 3. Users: Consume Magnum services to provision and manage clustered container environments and deploy apps within the container clusters. The container ecosystem focuses on the developer user type. It is imperative that the Magnum Container Networking Model meets the need of this user type. These roles are not necessarily disjointed. For example: 1. A CP can also be a CSP. In this case, the CP/CSP provisions and manages standard OpenStack services, the Magnum service, and provides CaaS services to users. 2. A User can also be CSP. In this case, the user provisions their own baymodels, bays, etc. from the CP. Use Cases ---------- This document does not intend to address each use case. The use cases are provided as reference for the long-term development of the Magnum Container Networking Model. As a User: 1. I need to easily deploy containerized apps in an OpenStack cloud. My user experience should be similar to how I deploy containerized apps outside of an OpenStack cloud. 2. I need my containerized apps to be highly performant when deployed in an OpenStack cloud. If my apps are more than marginally less performant, I will find this unacceptable. 3. I need to have my containerized apps work seamlessly with non-containerized apps to support migration and interoperability. For example, I may need to have containers communicate with vm-based apps that use standard OpenStack networking (Neutron/Nova). 4. I need the option to preserve the container's IP address so I can manage containers by IP's, not just ports. 5. I need to block unwanted traffic to/from my containerized apps. 6. I need to delegate automatic protocol/port filtering of containers. 7. I need the ability for my containerized apps to be high-available. 8. I need to know my traffic is secure from other tenants traffic. As a CSP: 1. I need to easily deploy a container orchestration engine for consumption by users. The engine must support the following: A. One or more hosts to run containers. B. The ability to choose between virtual or physical hosts to run containers. C. The ability to auto provision networking to containers. 2. I need to provide clustering options that support different container, image, etc. formats and technologies. 3. After deploying my initial cluster, I need the ability to provide ongoing management, including: A. The ability to add/change/remove networks that containers connect to. B. The ability to add/change/remove nodes within the cluster. 4. I need to deploy a container orchestration engine even through I don't have admin access to OpenStack services. 5. I need the flexibility to choose different container networking tools and techniques offered by the container ecosystem. As a CP: 1. I need to easily and reliably add the Magnum service to my existing OpenStack cloud environment. 2. I need to easily manage (monitor, troubleshoot, etc..) the Magnum service. Including the ability to duplicate connections, mirror ports, capture and store traffic for analysis. 3. I need to make the Magnum services highly-available. 4. I need to make Magnum services highly performant. 5. I need to easily scale-out Magnum services as needed. 6. I need Magnum to be robust regardless of failures within the container orchestration engine. 7. I need to quickly and easily identify where traffic is coming from, including tenant information, container within that tenant and host (physical or virtual) - and what its destination is. Proposed Changes ================ 1. Currently, Magnum supports Flannel[6] as the only multi-host container networking implementation. Although Flannel has become widely accepted for providing networking capabilities to Kubernetes-based container clusters, other networking tools exist and future tools may develop. This document proposes extending the Magnum API to support specifying a container networking implementation through a configuration flag named network_backend. Users will specify a network_backend when creating a baymodel. network_backend examples may include: flannel, libnetwork, weave, calico, midonet, netplugin, etc.. Here is an example of creating a baymodel with a specified network_backend: magnum baymodel-create --name k8sbaymodel \ --image-id fedora-21-atomic-3 \ --keypair-id testkey \ --external-network-id 1hsdhs88sddds889 \ --dns-nameserver 8.8.8.8 \ --flavor-id m1.small \ --docker-volume-size 5 \ --coe kubernetes \ --network_backend flannel Here is an example of updating the network_backend for an existing baymodel: magnum baymodel-update --name k8sbaymodel \ --network_backend libnetwork If no network_backend is specified, the baymodel is created using the default network_backend of the specified Magnum coe. Each coe must support a default network_backend and each network_backend must provide reasonable default configurations that allow users to instantiate containers without supplying any network configuration settings. The default network_backend for each coe should be consistent with existing Magnum default settings. Where current defaults do not exist, the defaults should be consistent with upstream projects. 2. Since each network_backend will support a range of configuration parameters and not just default settings, these parameters must be observed by Magnum. This document suggests observing these parameters through labels, an arbitrary key/value pair, or through network_backend specific configuration sections within magnum.conf. Here is an example of using a label to change default settings of the flannel network_backend: magnum baymodel-create --name k8sbaymodel \ --image-id fedora-21-atomic-3 \ --keypair-id testkey \ --external-network-id ${NIC_ID} \ --dns-nameserver 8.8.8.8 \ --flavor-id m1.small \ --docker-volume-size 5 \ --coe kubernetes \ --network_backend flannel \ --label flannel_network_cidr=10.0.0.0/8 \ --label flannel_network_subnetlen=22 \ --label flannel_use_vxlan=true Here is the same example, but using the configuration file approach: cat /etc/magnum/magnum.conf ... [flannel] network_cidr=10.0.0.0/8 network_subnetlen=22 use_vxlan=true ... Magnum currently supports labels for the Kubernetes coe type. Labels are applicable beyond Kubernetes, as the Docker daemon, images and containers now support labels as a mechanism for providing custom metadata. The label attribute within Magnum should be extended beyond Kubernetes pods, so a single mechanism can be used to pass arbitrary metadata throughout the entire system. A blueprint[2] has been registered to expand the scope of labels. If the label approach is selected for passing network_backend specific configuration parameters, the Magnum Container Networking Model should adhere to the expand-labels-scope blueprint. Note: Support for daemon-labels was added in Docker 1.4.1. Labels for containers and images were introduced in Docker 1.6.0 Heat template default parameters are used if no --label or magnum.conf network_backend configuration parameters are provided. If the label key and/or value is not understood by any of the templates during the baymodel operation, Magnum API should provide an appropriate error message to the user and the baymodel should not be created. Magnum will continue to CRUD bays in the same way: magnum bay-create --name k8sbay --baymodel k8sbaymodel --node-count 1 3. Update python-magnumclient to understand the new network_backend attribute. If the label approach is selected for passing network_backend specific configuration parameters, the client should also be updated to support passing the --label flag according to the expand-labels-scope blueprint[2]. 4. Update the conductor template definitions to support the network_backend attribute. If the label approach is selected for passing network_backend specific configuration parameters, template definitions should also be updated to support passing the --label flag according to the expand-labels-scope blueprint[2]. 5. Refactor Heat templates to support the Magnum Container Networking Model. Currently, Heat templates embed Flannel-specific configuration within top-level templates. For example, the top-level Kubernetes Heat template[8] contains the flannel_network_subnetlen parameter. Network backend specific configurations should be removed from all top-level templates and instead be implemented in one or more template fragments. As it relates to container networking, top-level templates should only expose the network_backend parameter. Heat templates, template definitions and definition entry points should be suited for composition, allowing for a range of supported network_backends. This document intends to follow the refactor-heat-templates blueprint[3] to achieve this goal. 6. Update unit and functional tests to support the network_backend attribute. 7. The spec will not add support for natively managing container networks. Due to each network_backend supporting different API operations, this document suggests that Magnum not natively manage container networks at this time and instead leave this job to native tools. References [4-7] provide additional details to the common network_backend API operations. Alternatives ------------ 1. Observe all networking configuration parameters, including network_backend as labels instead of exposing a network_backend attribute. Refer to the expand-labels-scope blueprint[2] for details. 2. Observe all networking configuration parameters, including network_backend within magnum.conf instead of exposing a network_backend attribute to the user. 3. Only support a single networking implementation such as Flannel. Flannel is currently supported for the Kubernetes coe type. It can be ported to support the swarm coe type. 4. Add support for managing container networks. This will require adding abstractions for each supported network_backend or creating an abstraction layer that covers all possible network_baackends. Data Model Impact ----------------- The spec adds the network_backend attribute to the database. A migration script will be provided to support the attribute being added. -------------------------------------------------------------------------- | Attribute | Type | Description | -------------------------------------------------------------------------| | network_backend | String | Container networking backend implementation | -------------------------------------------------------------------------- REST API Impact --------------- The spec adds network_backend attribute to the BayModel API class. -------------------------------------------------------------------------- | Attribute | Type | Description | -------------------------------------------------------------------------| | network_backend | String | Container networking backend implementation | -------------------------------------------------------------------------- Security Impact --------------- Supporting more than one container networking implementation increases the attack footprint of Magnum. Notifications Impact -------------------- The network_backend will use existing baymodel notifications. Other End User Impact --------------------- Most end users will never use the network_backend configuration flag and simply use the default network_backend and associated configuration options. For those that wish to customize their container networking environment, it will be important to understand what network_backends are supported, and their associated configuration options, capabilities, etc.. Performance Impact ------------------ Performance will depend upon the chosen network_backend and the its associated configuration. For example, when creating a baymodel with network_backend=flannel, Flannel's default configuration will be used. If the default for Flannel is an overlay networking technique (i.e. VXLAN), then networking performance will be less than if Flannel used the host-gw configuration that does not perform additional packet encapsulation to/from containers. If additional performance is required when using network_backend=flannel, Flannel's host-gw configuration option could be exposed by the associated Heat template and instantiated by a label or a magnum.conf setting. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- If the configuration file approach is used for managing network_backend configuration parameters, deployer's will need to manage these parameters. Additionally, deployer's will need to decide which network_backends they will support. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Daneyon Hansen (danehans) Other contributors: Ton Ngo (Tango) Hongbin Lu (hongbin) Work Items ---------- 1. Extend Magnum API to support baymodel network_backend attribute 2. Extend Client API to support baymodel network_backend attribute 3. Extend baymodel objects to include network_backend field. Provide a database migration script for adding the attribute. 4. Refactor Heat templates to support the Magnum Container Networking Model. 5. Update Conductor template definitions and definition entry points to support Heat template refactoring. 6. Extend unit and functional tests to support the network_backend attribute. Dependencies ============ Although adding support for network_backend does not depend on the following blueprints, it is highly recommended that the Magnum network model be developed in concert with the blueprints to maintain development continuity within the project. 1. Common Plugin Framework Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/common-plugin-framework 2. Expand the Scope of Labels Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/expand-labels-scope 3. Refactor Heat Templates, Definitions and Entry Points Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/refactor-heat-templates Testing ======= Each commit will be accompanied with unit tests. There will also be functional tests which will be used as part of a cross-functional gate test for Magnum. Documentation Impact ==================== The Magnum Developer Quickstart document will be updated to support the --network_backend baymodel flag. Additionally, background information on how to use the flag and supported network_backends will be included. References ========== [1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/common-plugin-framework [2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/expand-labels-scope [3] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/refactor-heat-templates [4] https://github.com/docker/libnetwork/blob/master/docs/design.md [5] https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/blob/master/docs/design/networking.md [6] https://github.com/coreos/flannel [7] https://github.com/coreos/rkt/blob/master/Documentation/networking.md [8] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/templates/heat-kubernetes/kubecluster.yaml

commit_message:
Remove unsed wrapper method

Since Ic542eefcd09c3d55ac69c22e35eb1f47d1a99363 , the removed wapper
method has been unused. So this patch removes it for the cleanup.

Change-Id: I95f43f81bf586eba83b30987df57f0ba2ca9ee3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/77/295477/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def wait_for_resource_status(self, stack_identifier, resource_name, status, failure_pattern='^.*_FAILED$'): """Waits for a Resource to reach a given status.""" start = int(time.time()) fail_regexp = re.compile(failure_pattern) while True: try: body = self.show_resource( stack_identifier, resource_name)['resource'] except lib_exc.NotFound: # ignore this, as the resource may not have # been created yet pass else: resource_name = body['resource_name'] resource_status = body['resource_status'] if resource_status == status: return if fail_regexp.search(resource_status): raise exceptions.StackResourceBuildErrorException( resource_name=resource_name, stack_identifier=stack_identifier, resource_status=resource_status, resource_status_reason=body['resource_status_reason']) if int(time.time()) - start >= self.build_timeout: message = ('Resource %s failed to reach %s status ' '(current %s) within the required time (%s s).' % (resource_name, status, resource_status, self.build_timeout)) raise exceptions.TimeoutException(message) time.sleep(self.build_interval)

commit_message:
[User Guides] Troubleshooting Sections Reorganised.

1.) This patch edits and reorganises troubleshooting sections
    of the Cloud Admin Guide for consistency. It changes the
    format of each section to use the same 'problem' and
    'solution' structure.

Implements: blueprint user-guides-reorganised

Change-Id: I8b73cc19f0bdb6f5e4acf7ecc998c8e372d31f3d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/26/295626/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Problem ~~~~~~~ You cannot reach your instances through the floating IP address. Solution ~~~~~~~~Problem ~~~~~~~ Networking issues prevent administrators accessing or reaching VM's through various pathways. Solution ~~~~~~~~ You can disable the firewall by setting this option in ``/etc/nova/nova.conf``:.. :warning: We strongly recommend you remove this line to re-enable the firewall once your networking issues have been resolved.Problem ~~~~~~~ Solution ~~~~~~~~ Problem ~~~~~~~ Solution ~~~~~~~~
deleted_lines: If you cannot reach your instances through the floating IP address:To help debug networking issues with reaching VMs, you can disable the firewall by setting this option in ``/etc/nova/nova.conf``:We strongly recommend you remove this line to re-enable the firewall once your networking issues have been resolved.

commit_message:
Check relevant logging mechanism in the gate

Avoids errors about missing journalctl on Ubuntu and missing upstart on
redhat bases.

Closes-Bug: 1554724

Change-Id: I80bb55688398df85f9020d5cfe5dda757fc5a0ef
(cherry picked from commit c25002c3d875c6dc48da735a802bb4dcd9cec11d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/09/295909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ -x "$(command -v journalctl)" ]]; then journalctl --no-pager -u docker.service else cat /var/log/upstart/docker.log fi

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-14 04:31:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/eb6e94068f7b7c74ad941336911bb22e41b2852d', 'message': 'Reorganised Quickstart chapter [WIP]

commit_message:
Use imageutils from oslo_utils

We clean up oslo-incubator in 90ae25e38915cc502d9e9c52d59e8fb668a72ae1,
and sync imageutils to oslo.utis with unittest in version 3.1.
This patch switch to use oslo.utils' imageutils.

Co-Authored-By: ChangBo Guo(gcb) <eric.guo@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: Ie8d5bcfc31e620041d23d773b9f834e685c8dd98

subject: Fix race condition when toggling SP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 02:19:29.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_emc_vnx.py', 'cinder/exception.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vnx_cli.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/cf686d8416dd9cf2c330db89701dd782753021a2', 'message': 'Fix race condition when toggling SP

Currently, VNX driver provides SP toggle feature which would try
another IP if primary IP became unavailable.
Unfortunately, driver did not protect the toggling SP logic in a
lock section so if many toggles happen in a short time, race
condition may occur and driver would try the unavailable IP again.

This fix provides a safe way to toggle and swap current primary IP
to avoid above mentioned issue.

Change-Id: I4af960a625dafbe868f12d275cf9b34eb254a388
Closes-Bug: 1526600
(cherry picked from commit 5785c74ce1ea4cae2edf06e96e856a0587dcddff)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition when toggling SP

Currently, VNX driver provides SP toggle feature which would try
another IP if primary IP became unavailable.
Unfortunately, driver did not protect the toggling SP logic in a
lock section so if many toggles happen in a short time, race
condition may occur and driver would try the unavailable IP again.

This fix provides a safe way to toggle and swap current primary IP
to avoid above mentioned issue.

Change-Id: I4af960a625dafbe868f12d275cf9b34eb254a388
Closes-Bug: 1526600
(cherry picked from commit 5785c74ce1ea4cae2edf06e96e856a0587dcddff)

commit_message:
Check for duplicates without inserting in keystone-manage bootstrap

keystone-manage checks for already present information in the DB by
trying an insert and catching a Conflict exception.
This will not work in databases where inserting is not possible.
Removed all instances of catching a Conflict exception by first
trying to get with the appropriate methods.

Change-Id: If4c8cfafc6f50d787d3973897fc9d3db1e82ff17
Closes-Bug: 1553216

High Availability Guide ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Added the `Highly available Shared File Systems API <http://docs.openstack.org/ha-guide/storage-ha-manila.html>`_ section. * Improved `Pacemaker/Corosync cluster <http://docs.openstack.org/ha-guide/controller-ha-pacemaker.html>`_ installation and configuration details. * Documented the `Pacemaker cluster manager <http://docs.openstack.org/ha-guide/intro-ha-arch-pacemaker.html>`_ and `Keepalived architecture <http://docs.openstack.org/ha-guide/intro-ha-arch-keepalived.html>`_ details and limitations. * Added the `MariaDB Galera cluster <http://docs.openstack.org/ha-guide/controller-ha-galera.html>`_ installation, configuration, and management details. * Improved the `RabbitMQ section <http://docs.openstack.org/ha-guide/controller-ha-rabbitmq.html>`_.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Added the Shared File Systems chapter.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Command-Line Interface Reference ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Completed RST conversion. Architecture Design Guide ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Completed RST conversion. API Guides ~~~~~~~~~~ * Swagger files now built to http://developer.openstack.org/ * Created templates for writing API guides for projects teams available in projects repositories. ~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Published the Networking guide as a draft.
deleted_lines: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Tracking of release notes in `doc/releasenotes/` directory.----------------------- * RST conversion completed. * Message service (zaqar) is documented. HA Guide -------- * Shared File Systems chapter added.---------------- * Shared File Systems chapter added.--------------------------- * RST conversion finished. Command-Line Interface Reference -------------------------------- * RST conversion finished. Architecture Design Guide ------------------------------------- * Publish networking guide as draft.

commit_message:
Fix the get/set queue metadata in v1.1

Now there are some problems about get/set queue metadata:
1. As v1.1 and v2 don't contain the queue.exist() function,
and the queue exist check has been done in server side. We
should remove it in get metadata.
2. As v1.1 donesn't support PATCH in zaqar server side,
we should not allow set metadta in v1.1.

Closes-bug: #1554326
Change-Id: I9f2571dc19efb79404a2d0f3e7f94d850f6c2963

subject: Refactor the v3 only job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-22 03:40:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/b0085416d46d98d0fb18eb4654464f53ccafb1d9', 'message': 'Run the identity v3 only jobs as part of integrated gate

Promote the v3 identity only gate job into the integrated gate template.
This should ensure that it runs for all the services.

The job is still non-voting by default but has been changed to include
{name} so that as services start passing the check they can be made
voting individually.

The keystone team has been trying to move people off the V2 API for a
while now and this job has been successfully running on the devstack
gate for a while now, but as is does not give us any indication of the
readiness of other services. We need to run this against individual
services.

commit_message:
Refactor the v3 only job

Refactor the identity v3 only job that was being run against devstack so
that it can be applied to additional services. The keystone team has
been trying to move people off the V2 API for a while now and this job
has been successfully running on the devstack gate for a while now, but
as is does not give us any indication of the readiness of other
services. We need to run this against individual services.

As part of this we change the job from always non-voting to using the
-nv suffix so that we can start making the job voting on a per-service
basis as services get fixed.

Change-Id: I90e7fdd93f243f2568370f084001531c50cb080e

commit_message:
Comment out the ManagementPort in external-loadbalancer-vip.yaml

The Management network is optional and disabled by default.
This change preserves backward compatibility and fixes
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1317594

Change-Id: I73cf51154c9ee7c05938e2cadf0c5ac107840bad

commit_message:
Fix a logic error and add unit tests in retry-wrapper

Change-Id: I274accf2098d8e794530b9041cb39b89208ddebe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/80/295080/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from dragonflow.common import utils from dragonflow.tests import base as tests_base class TestRetryFunc(tests_base.BaseTestCase): def test_retry_wrapper_succeeds(self): @utils.wrap_func_retry(max_retries=10) def some_method(): pass some_method() def test_retry_wrapper_reaches_limit(self): @utils.wrap_func_retry(max_retries=10, _errors=[ValueError]) def some_method(res): res['result'] += 1 raise ValueError() res = {'result': 0} self.assertRaises(ValueError, some_method, res) self.assertEqual(11, res['result']) def test_retry_wrapper_exception_checker(self): def exception_checker(exc): return isinstance(exc, ValueError) @utils.wrap_func_retry(max_retries=10, _errors=[ValueError], exception_checker=exception_checker) def some_method(res): res['result'] += 1 raise ValueError(res['result']) res = {'result': 0} self.assertRaises(ValueError, some_method, res) # our exception checker should have stopped returning True after 5 self.assertEqual(11, res['result']) @mock.patch('dragonflow.common.utils.LOG') def test_retry_wrapper_non_error_not_logged(self, mock_log): # Tests that if the retry wrapper hits a target error (raised from the # wrapped function), then that exception is reraised but not logged. @utils.wrap_func_retry(max_retries=5, _errors=[ValueError]) def some_method(): raise AttributeError('test') self.assertRaises(AttributeError, some_method) self.assertFalse(mock_log.called)

commit_message:
Update devstack plugin for dependent packages

Recent changes to the gate base images [1] removed a package
neutron-lbaas requires (software-properties-common).
This patch loads it before running 'add-apt-repository'.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/292573

This is not a cherry-pick from master as there were issues
getting "System Packages" to work correctly in the gate
in stable/kilo.

Conflicts:
	devstack/plugin.sh

Change-Id: Id16da90e195ede8a7565b3265374cb603b6eb898
Closes-Bug: #1558289
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/20/295920/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo apt-get -y install software-properties-common

commit_message:
Fix attr for vim update

Vim resource attr 'type' does not allow a PUT operation. Updated
the vim args to refelct typeattr for POST operation only. Also
fixed the vim name arg for vnf create command

Change-Id: I3c08945f24343288c2c5614ab4b472d68a1e1d47
